title: E0277: suggest `?Sized` to relax implicit `Sized` bound on associated types

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: A-associated-items
labels.description: Area: Associated items such as associated types and consts.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-papercut
labels.description: Diagnostic error that needs small tweaks

labels.name: D-terse
labels.description: A diagnostic that doesn't give enough information about the problem at hand

body:
Given the following code: [(playground)](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=9e10548141bcdd05e57230114dabdc54)

```rust
trait TraitWithAType {
    type Item;
}
trait Trait {}
struct A {}
impl TraitWithAType for A {
    type Item = dyn Trait;
}
```

The current output is:

```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error[E0277]: the size for values of type `(dyn Trait + 'static)` cannot be known at compilation time
 --> src/lib.rs:7:5
  |
2 |     type Item;
  |     ---------- required by this bound in `TraitWithAType::Item`
...
7 |     type Item = dyn Trait;
  |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ doesn't have a size known at compile-time
  |
  = help: the trait `Sized` is not implemented for `(dyn Trait + 'static)`

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0277`.
error: could not compile `playground`

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```

<!-- The following is not always necessary. -->
Ideally the output should look like:

```
  |
2 |     type Item;
  |     ---------- required by this bound in `TraitWithAType::Item`
...
7 |     type Item = dyn Trait;
  |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ doesn't have a size known at compile-time
  |
  = help: the trait `Sized` is not implemented for `(dyn Trait + 'static)`
help: consider relaxing the implicit `Sized` restriction
  |
2 |     type Item: ?Sized
  |              ^^^^^^^^
```

A similar error message with an unsized generic type argument _does_ mention the implicit `Sized` bound. [(playground)](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=764e262216d72078b210315931fd1851) Unfortunately, it also doesn't explain the implicit bound up front in the "required by this bound" text. (It mentions it when suggesting to relax the implicit bound, but I think it would be better to mention it up front as well.)

Both error messages could benefit from changing the "required by this bound" text to "required by an implicit `Sized` bound".
